name: Honouliuli National Historic Site
description: The park is working on our General Management Plan, which we hope to be able to share with you soon.
shortDescription: The park is working on our General Management Plan, which we hope to be able to share with you soon.

operatingHours.description: Honouliuli National Monument is currently closed to the public.

climate.weatherDescription: The temperature ranges from 70°F/22°C to 85°F/29°C year round with light tropical showers common.

images.title: Honouliuli Historic Overlay
images.altText: Satellite image of Honouliuli Gulch with a historic overlay illustrating Honouliuli's layout
images.caption: Historic overlay illustrating the layout of Honouliuli Internment and POW Camp
images.credit: National Register Boundary (NPS), Historic and Modern Features by Jeff Burton and Mary Farrell

images.title: Honouliuli Aqueduct
images.altText: View down the aqueduct at Honouliuli Gulch
images.caption: An aqueduct separated prisoners of war from internees at Honouliuli Internment Camp. The aqueduct provided water for both internment and prisoners of war camps.

images.title: Honouliuli Retaining Wall
images.caption: This stone wall played a crucial role in the rediscovery of Honouliuli

images.title: Stakeholders Meeting
images.caption: The first Honouliuli National Monument stakeholders meeting

images.title: Modern view South from Honouliuli Overlook
images.altText: Overlook towards south of Honouliuli Gulch
images.caption: Looking towards the south of the gulch with Pearl Harbor in the distance

images.title: Modern view across from Honouliuli Overlook
images.caption: A look across the gulch from the overlook

images.title: Modern view North from Honouliuli Overlook
images.altText: Overview of Honouliuli Gulch looking north
images.caption: Overview towards the north with the Wai‘anae range in the distance

images.title: Honouliuli internee barracks
images.altText: An overview of the American Internee barracks
images.caption: The American Internee barracks at Honouliuli Compound #5, circa 1945
images.credit: Photograph by R. H. Lodge. Courtesy of Japanese Cultural Center of Hawai‘i / Hawaii’s Plantation Vil

images.title: Park Ranger
images.altText: A park ranger speaking to a young visitor about the National Park
images.caption: A Park Ranger helping a young visitor
